key_points: CNN host Chris Cuomo has recused himself from covering sexual harassment allegations against his brother, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
This recusal follows a third account of sexual harassment against Governor Cuomo, this time corroborated with a photo.
Chris Cuomo addresses the conflict of interest due to the familial relationship, acknowledging CNN's responsibility to cover the story.
Previously, Chris Cuomo had extensively covered his brother during the early days of COVID-19, drawing criticism for lack of objectivity.
CNN had to reverse a rule instituted in late 2013 banning Chris from interviewing his brother on-air due to ethical concerns.
The Cuomo brothers' interviews were known for their emotional punch and familial banter.
Chris Cuomo has expressed on his SiriusXM radio show that the interviews showcased Governor Cuomo's relatable side during the pandemic.
CNN president Jeffrey Zucker cited the 'authenticity, reliability and vulnerability' of the Cuomo interviews as beneficial in early pandemic days.
Cuomo Prime Time's audience significantly increased during the period Governor Cuomo was frequently interviewed.
Some commentators have criticized the Cuomo-on-Cuomo interviews as unethical and propagandistic.
